plant_translocations.content: The experimental fungicide E-0858 has been identified and confirmed as -[5-(2-methoxypyridinyl)]-cyclopropane-carboxamide with a molecular mass of 192 Da. It belongs to a new class of fungicides and has a heterocyclic, anilide derivative structure with an empirical formula of C₁₄H₁₅NO. Translocation studies using autoradiography, thin-layer chromatography (TLC), and combustion to radioactive carbon dioxide were conducted on almond floral tissues treated with 'C-E-0858 and 'C-iprodione. The fungicides were applied to either the petals or the sepals of closed blossoms on detached shoots from almond trees of different ages. The results showed that translocation of 'C-E-0858 into stamens and pistils ranged from 4 to 8% of the recovered radioactivity, while 'C-iprodione showed a lower translocation of 1 to 3% in the same tissues. On potted plants, translocation of the fungicides into internal floral parts ranged from 1 to 2% for E-0858 and was 1% for iprodione. Higher radioactive counts were observed in stamens and pistils when the fungicides were applied to the sepals rather than the petals. TLC analysis of 'C-E-0858-treated blossoms revealed three radioactive spots, but only the parent compound showed fungitoxic activity against the mycelium of Monilinia laxa. Some of the 'C-iprodione was converted into three radioactive products in almond blossoms, with the parent compound and one metabolite exhibiting fungitoxic activity against M. laxa. Bioassays demonstrated that E-0858 and iprodione applied to closed blossoms provided stamen protection similar to that of the systemic fungicide benomyl.
plant_translocations.reference: Osorio, J. M., Adaskaveg, J. E., Ogawa, J. M., Bostock, R. M., & Jones, A. D. Systemic Activity and Fungitoxicity of Iprodione and E-0858 (N-15-(2-methoxypyridinyl)-Cyclopropane-Carboxamide).

method.Plant Grown Condition: Unopened blossoms at the pink bud stage of bloom
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: 10 μl of 300 μg a.i./ml (1.5 μCi/ml) E-0858 or iprodione applied to unopened almond blossoms
method.Other Information: Five replicates in the detached-shoot experiments (one blossom per shoot) and seven replicates in the potted plant experiments (one blossom per plant). Translocation expressed as the percentage of radioactivity recovered per blossom. Percent radioactivity of each fungicide recovered in each blossom part compared using general linear model and t test procedures (SAS, version 6.04. SAS Institute Inc., Cary, NC). Fungitoxicity assessed based on the zone of mycelial inhibition formed around each spot and rated as positive (inhibition) or negative (no inhibition). Each treatment replicated four times, and the experiment performed twice.
